intro: Fuirena umbellata var. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy umbellate fuirena, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical environments.
